decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to control the game using a combination of counterspells and disruption while utilizing Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes cards like Flash and Into the Flood Maw to quickly put creatures into play, along with powerful tutors and card draw spells to find key pieces when needed. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes several powerful mana-producing artifacts to accelerate the game. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly establishing a dominant board presence.

This deck aims to control the game through a combination of disruption and card advantage, using powerful spells and abilities to hinder opponents while drawing into key cards. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds consistency to the deck, while the mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw helps to maintain board control and outvalue opponents. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration and land destruction to disrupt opponents' plans and keep them on the back foot. The overall strategy is to outlast opponents and grind out a win through attrition and resource management.

This deck focuses on using Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana with multiple fast mana sources like Moxen and other artifacts. The goal is to chain together spells to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards, ultimately setting up a game-winning combo using cards like Brain Freeze or Ancestral Recall. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to recur important cards from your graveyard. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and various counterspells to protect your combo pieces.

This deck focuses on utilizing a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The main goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value by allowing the player to recast low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus and the Moxen, enabling the player to cast multiple spells in a turn.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by using various counterspells and removal spells while utilizing graveyard recursion and card advantage with cards like Gifts Ungiven and LÃ³rien Revealed. The deck also aims to generate mana advantage with powerful artifacts like Black Lotus, Moxen, and Mana Crypt. Overall, the deck is built to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient use of resources and powerful control elements in a Vintage 1 vs 1 setting.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with aggressive artifacts. It aims to control the board with cards like Nettlecyst, Sphere of Resistance, and Thorn of Amethyst while also ramping up mana with Crucible of Worlds and Urza's Saga. The deck utilizes powerful artifacts like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Mystic Forge for card advantage and additional threats. It also includes disruptive spells like Null Rod and Trinisphere to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With strong mana acceleration and disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The deck is centered around using artifacts and various spells to generate mana and draw cards, with the ultimate goal of assembling a key combo involving Time Vault, along with cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Sensei's Divining Top to gain value and keep the combo going. The deck also includes disruption and tutors to help find the necessary pieces to execute the combo efficiently, making it a powerful and versatile archetype in the Vintage format.

This deck focuses on assembling powerful artifact combos, with Coveted Jewel as the central piece. The deck includes cards like Phyrexian Metamorph and Grim Monolith to generate mana, while also utilizing cards like The One Ring and Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and find key pieces. Key cards like Time Vault and Voltaic Key can enable infinite turns, leading to a win condition. With disruption like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect the combo, the deck aims to quickly assemble its pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful synergies.

This vintage Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful card advantage engines such as Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push to control the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for consistent recursion of key threats. Additionally, the deck incorporates various forms of graveyard hate and artifact disruption to further hinder opponents' game plans. Overall, the main goal of this deck is to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of card advantage and disruption.

The main concept of this Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Shambling Shell, allowing you to bring back powerful creatures like Ichorid and Narcomoeba while triggering abilities like Prized Amalgam. By utilizing cards like Serum Powder and Bazaar of Baghdad, you can rapidly dig through your deck and set up explosive plays. With access to disruptive cards like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void, you can protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's strategy, leading to a quick and overwhelming victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand while utilizing powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor to gain card advantage and search for answers. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Stony Silence to shut down opposing strategies. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Counterspells helps the deck interact effectively with the opponent while maintaining a strong board presence with cards like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, ensuring the deck can adapt to any situation.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disruption and removal spells to control the game, while also utilizing various powerful combo pieces and card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Psychic Frog to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of countermagic, removal, and powerful spells, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponent in a 1 vs 1 Vintage match.

The deck focuses on using a combination of powerful artifacts and control spells to manipulate the game in your favor. By utilizing cards like Time Vault and Mana Crypt alongside powerful control cards like Force of Will and Demonic Tutor, the deck seeks to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent. With access to powerful planeswalkers like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and cards like Bolas's Citadel, the deck can generate powerful combos and advantages. The deck's key strategy is to control the game's tempo and resources while setting up for a game-winning play using its versatile cards.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Oath of Druids card to quickly get powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield. It also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to control the game and protect the combo. The deck runs a low land count with powerful mana accelerants like Black Lotus and Moxen to quickly ramp into its threats. It also includes versatile cards like Show and Tell and Stock Up to help find key pieces of the combo. The deck aims to control the game while quickly assembling its win condition.

The deck revolves around generating advantage through card draw and mana acceleration with cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Mox Opal, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The goal is to set up a powerful board state with cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Lurrus of the Dream-Den, ultimately leading to a combo finish with cards like Flame of Anor or Stock Up. The deck aims to control the game and win quickly once it establishes its strategy.
